name: Direction Manager
description: Employee from this level leads two or more departments and supervises large number of people, direct reports include positions from First Time Manager, Manager of Managers and Functional Manager levels. Direction Manager develops and implements integrated functional/business models necessary to achieve strategic business goals of the company. This category may also cover qualified individual contributors who deliver a job that is key to the company, these positions would contribute to the organization through their professional leadership. Closely advise the deputy CEO on functional/Business strategy. Huge Network - the position has external or Internal network span that are both strategically and operationally critical. Following position represents Direction Manager level: Deputy of Deputy CEO, Partner

timeApplication.name: Time Application
timeApplication.description:
• Build business strategy and integrate functional work
  • Think based on "should we do it?" rather than "doing it better"
  • Learn key ingredients of new functions
  • Balance between short-term and long-term business positioning, prioritize from the "whole business" point of view
  • Spend time with Functional Managers to ask questions, listen to the answers and reflect on what is heard
  • Self-directed development

workValues.name: Work Values
workValues.description:
• Accountability for making a product or creating a service and selling it
  • Value all owned functions appropriately
  • Be the custodian of the culture: treasure Organizational Beliefs
  • Tremendous sense of ownership
  • Recognize and accept feedback

behaviours.name: Treasure Organizational Beliefs
behaviours.description: Treasure Organizational Beliefs measures the extent to which the leader values culture and organizational beliefs, assigns high priority to this responsibility, eagerly spends time, emotional energy on assessing or reshaping their business cultures

behaviours.name: Consistency
behaviours.description: Consistency measures the extent to which the leader shows consistency between words and actions, delivers what is promised

behaviours.name: Authenticity
behaviours.description: Authenticity measures how sincere and genuine is the leader, is true to him/herself, shares his/her real thoughts, beliefs and opinions, fosters an environment of mutual trust

behaviours.name: Appetite for Accomplishment
behaviours.description: Appetite for Accomplishment measures how readily the leader  tackles tough assignments, faces difficult issues, is willing to champion an idea or position despite dissent risk

behaviours.name: Self-Confidence
behaviours.description: Self-Confidence measures the extent to which the leader is self-confident conceding own lack of knowledge, says "I don't know", when uncertain about answers or decisions, and then makes a commitment to find the answers by a certain date

behaviours.name: Pretest ideas
behaviours.description: Pretest ideas measures how successfully the leader handles the spotlight by pretesting ideas, decisions and proposals with trusted associates, determines how externals assess a move and counts it in decision-making process, is open and flexible when his/her positions are questioned in public, not placed in the position of becoming locked in

behaviours.name: Build the team
behaviours.description: Build the team measures how effectively the leader assembles strong team and leads it, provides encouragement and understanding necessary for subordinate managers to work well together and cope successfully with complexity, unfamiliarity and volume of work, relies on team rather than being reliant to one manager

behaviours.name: Multidiscipline approach
behaviours.description: Multidiscipline approach measures the extent to which the leader has multidiscipline approach - makes connections among diverse people, functions, and processes for short term as well as long term strategy, and integrate those functions for growing results

behaviours.name: Omni functional Language
behaviours.description: Omni functional Language measures how effectively the leader speaks in Omni functional language understandable for all integrated functions

behaviours.name: Business Strategic Thinking
behaviours.description: Business Strategic Thinking measures the extent to which the leader thinks in terms of profitability and sustainable competitive advantage within global complex, incorporating events taking place in industry and the world:  customers, competitors, demographics, macro-economic drivers, governments and communities, shifts from "doing it better" to "should we do it?" and "How"?

behaviours.name: Manage cost and revenue
behaviours.description: Manage cost and revenue measures how effectively the leader manages cost and revenue, recognizes where profit comes from

behaviours.name: Use support functions
behaviours.description: Use support functions measures how effectively the leader uses the support functions (Finance, Risks, Legal, Operations, HR, Branding, etc.) as an early warning system for issues/problems in a business, to fix or contain problem before it explodesroblems in a business, to fix or contain problem before it explodes

behaviours.name: Drive Performance
behaviours.description: Drive Performance measures the extent to which the leader stays aware whether direct reports are following through their commitments, heeds observations how the subordinate team is doing and acts on these observations ensuring the team is performing on at its full potential delivering consistent, predictable top and bottom line results

behaviours.name: Omni functional Recruitment
behaviours.description: Omni functional Recruitment measures the extent to which the leader knows how to recruit for diverse functions (outside their function - the one he/she came up through) to secure the people necessary for a strong team

behaviours.name: Shift Assignments
behaviours.description: Shift Assignments measures the extent to which the leader finds trusted advisors within functional teams and shifts assignments to people possessing necessary knowledge

behaviours.name: Interpersonal Savvy
behaviours.description: Interpersonal Savvy measures the extent to which the leader is a team player and cooperative, maintains and develops relationships, expands strong formal and informal networks across functions and locations, responds well to and relates comfortably with people similar and different to him/her-self, across levels, functions

behaviours.name: Listening to Sensitive Issues
behaviours.description: Listening to Sensitive Issues measures the extent to which the leader is able to listen not only to what is being said but what is not being said, alert for topics that are avoided for hesitancy about addressing a particular problem; is able to cross-check frames of references and avoid misinterpretation based on individual assumptions

behaviours.name: Engaging Dialogs
behaviours.description: Engaging Dialogs measures how effectively the leader engages others in dialogue, listens carefully and reflect on what's is told, helping subordinates to accept questions and uncertainties, to learn what they do not know and motivating them to share their knowledge and ideas with end-users

behaviours.name: Self-Awareness
behaviours.description: Self-Awareness measures the extent to which the leader recognizes the need to change personal, interpersonal, and managerial behavior; reflects on activities and impacts on others, proactively seeks feedback without being defensive, is open to criticism and talking about shortcomings, admits mistakes and gains insight from experiences, knows strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and limits

behaviours.name: Committed Learner
behaviours.description: Committed Learner measures the extent to which the leader takes action to continuously improve, seeks learning opportunities from networks, forums, reading, talks by academics and other thought leaders, accepts assignments that broaden capabilities, makes the most of available development resources

behaviours.name: Manage self-development
behaviours.description: Manage self-development measures how effectively the leader manages self-development to shape and connect the diverse responsibilities and requirements of his/her position uses assistance from functional teams as well as from boss
